clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of Activities of Daily Living in Adults With Chronic Low Back Pain Using a Nonoperative Treatment Modality
clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of Activities of Daily Living in Adults With Chronic Low Back Pain Using a Nonoperative Treatment Modality: A Retrospective Study

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators hypothesize that treatment with non-invasive spinal decompression reduces discogenic low back pain (LBP), decreases visual analog pain scale scores, increases activities of daily living and decreases medication use.

primary_outcome.measure: Lower back pain measured on an 11-point numeric rating scale (VAS) with 0 reflecting no pain at all and 10 the worst imaginable pain.

secondary_outcome.measure: Functional capacity, measured by activities of daily living
Proportion of patients using adjuvant analgesic medication
